meanings.definition: To cut off the edge or corner of something at an angle.
meanings.sent1: He chamfered the wood to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter chamfered the edges of the table for a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel chamfered the acorn to confuse the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her words were chamfered with kindness, taking the edge off the criticism.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully chamfered the marble, revealing a masterpiece within.

meanings.definition: Having a beveled edge or corner.
meanings.sent1: The chamfered mirror added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The chamfered edges of the frame gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The chamfered cake looked too perfect to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her chamfered smile hinted at a hidden sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The chamfered design of the building caught the sunlight beautifully.
